intro: Tetracera claessensii, commonly known as the African star gooseberry, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and smooth, woody stems. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating, while its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hard seeds. Tetracera claessensii is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
